dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A 5,400-square-foot mansion in Beverly Hills, just sold for $13.5 million, and it's got everyone talking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A five thousand, four hundred-square-foot mansion in Beverly Hills, just sold for thirteen point five dollars million, and it's got everyone talking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 5,400-square-foot mansion was recently sold. The reported $13.5 million price was squarely within the range of what could be expected for the house.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the one on North Canon Drive, right? The New York Times reported it might have ties to an Indonesian billionaire, Hary Tanoesoedibjo.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the one on North Canon Drive, right? The New York Times reported it might have ties to an Indonesian billionaire, Hary Tanoesoedibjo.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The next day, the Washington Post reported that Hillcrest has ties to Indonesian billionaire Hary Tanoesoedibjo and suggested that the house may have gone for an inflated price.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Rachel Maddow did a whole segment asking why someone would radically overpay the president for that property.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Rachel Maddow did a whole segment asking why someone would radically overpay the president for that property.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And Thursday night, MSNBC host Rachel Maddow ran a lengthy segment on the deal, asking: Why did someone just radically overpay the president for a property in Los Angeles?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But here's the thing—it turns out they didn't overpay. Forbes had actually estimated its value at $13.1 million just a few months ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here's the thing-it turns out they didn't overpay. Forbes had actually estimated its value at thirteen point one dollars million just a few months ago.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In February, Forbes valued the property at $13 million as part of its twice-annual look at the size of Donald Trumps fortune.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they spoke with five local brokers who said it could go for anywhere between 11 and 15 million. So 13.5 is right in that range.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they spoke with five local brokers who said it could go for anywhere between eleven and fifteen million. So thirteen point five is right in that range.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That estimate, just 4% off the reported sales price, was based on conversations with five local real estate brokers, who suggested the property could be worth anywhere from $11 million to $15 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even Joe Babajian from Rodeo Realty, who gave the lowest estimate, said it wasn't an outrageous price.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even Joe Babajian from Rodeo Realty, who gave the lowest estimate, said it wasn't an outrageous price.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even the broker who offered the lowest estimate, Joe Babajian of Rodeo Realty, said that $13.5 million was not an outrageous amount of money: Its definitely in the range.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then Forbes talked to a sixth broker, Mitra Sisatar from Coldwell Banker—she confirmed it was within range too, even though someone else couldn't sell it earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Forbes talked to a sixth broker, Mitra Sisatar from Coldwell Banker-she confirmed it was within range too, even though someone else couldn't sell it earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Friday, Forbes interviewed a sixth broker, Mitra Sisatar of Coldwell Banker. She said one of her colleagues tried to sell Trumps house a few months ago. He couldnt sell it, or he didnt have enough showings. Even so, Sisatar said, $13.5 million was within the range someone might expect for the property.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So all this hype about Trump getting richer off the presidency? Not necessarily true. He bought it for 7 million back in 2006.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So all this hype about Trump getting richer off the presidency? Not necessarily true. He bought it for seven million back in two thousand six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yes, Trump bought the place for $7 million in 2007.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the county assesses it at 8.5 million today, but market value's obviously way higher now after 12 years of appreciation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the county assesses it at eight point five million today, but market value's obviously way higher now after twelve years of appreciation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And yes, Los Angeles County assesses it at $8.4 million today.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: If anything, if he pays taxes on that gain, his net worth might actually take a hit from this sale.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: If anything, if he pays taxes on that gain, his net worth might actually take a hit from this sale.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If President Trump pays taxes on his apparent $6.5 million gain, his recent transaction could actually knock down his estimated net worth rather than boost it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But—and this is a big but—there are still ethics concerns. Tanoesoedibjo is a business partner of Trump's with political ambitions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But-and this is a big but-there are still ethics concerns. Tanoesoedibjo is a business partner of Trump's with political ambitions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: None of which is to say the recent sale is free of ethics concerns. Tanoesoedibjo is an Indonesian business partner of Donald Trump, with his own ambitions for political office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, some brokers even admitted the buyer might've paid a slight premium just because it was the president selling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, some brokers even admitted the buyer might've paid a slight premium just because it was the president selling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another local broker, Ernie Carswell, agreed: I believe it sold at the slight premium simply because of who the seller was.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if Tanoesoedibjo is indeed the buyer, that would break Trump's pledge about no new foreign deals during his presidency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if Tanoesoedibjo is indeed the buyer, that would break Trump's pledge about no new foreign deals during his presidency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shortly before Trumps inauguration, his lawyer promised no new foreign deals will be made whatsoever during the duration of President Trumps presidency. If Tanoesoedibjo is in fact the buyer, the recent sale would seem to violate Trumps pledge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, let's be honest, wouldn't be the first time he's crossed that line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, let's be honest, wouldn't be the first time he's crossed that line.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Not that it would be the first time Trump crossed that line. The president has counted state-owned banks from China and India as tenants in two of his buildings.
